National Senior Advisor, and Florida Chief Strategist  Karen Giorno
(expanded role announced July 1, 2016)  Southeast regional political
director from March 2015 after serving as state director for the Florida
primary campaign (announced Oct. 2, 2015).  Principal and founder (April
2005) of Kingston Public Affairs in New York.  25 years experience in
public relations, communications, organizational management, and
presidential advance operations.  Florida state director of American
Commitment (group founded by Phil Karpen), Jan. 2012-Feb. 2013.  Director
of external affairs in the Office of Gov. Rick Scott (FL), 2011-12.
Director of press advance and operations at Meg Whitman for Governor (CA),
March-Nov. 2010.  Senior advance rep. for First Lady Laura Bush, Sept.
2003-Jan. 2009.  Senior advance rep., press advance and scheduler for the
office of former President George H.W. Bush, Jan. 2001-March 2007.  B.A.
in political science and communications from Marymount University, 1990.
Senior Advisor for Battleground Communications  Susie Wiles
(reported by The Washington Post's Sean Sulllivan on Aug. 29, 2016)
Managing partner of the Jacksonville office of Ballard Partners since 2011
and principal at Right Coast Strategies from 2011.   Initial campaign
manager on Jon Huntsman's presidential campaign, started as executive
director of H-PAC in late Jan. 2011; resigned July 21, 2011.  Campaign
manager on Rick Scott's successful run for Governor of Florida, 2010.
Chief of communications and special initiatives under Jacksonville Mayor
John Peyton for five years through June 2008.  Principal at Wiles
Consulting, Inc. 2001-04.  Co-managing partner in the Florida office of
APCO Worldwide, 2000-01.  Senior executive under Jacksonville Mayor John
Delaney including as his chief of staff, 1995-99.   District director to
U.S. Rep. Tillie K. Fowler (FL), 1992-95.  Deputy director of operations
for the vice presidential campaign on Bush-Quayle '88.  Principal at
Summerall, Smith & Wiles, 1984-86.  Special assistant to U.S. Secretary of
Labor Ray Donovan, 1982-83.  Special Assistant (scheduler) to President
Reagan, 1980-81.  Deputy director of scheduling on Ronald Reagan's 1980
presidential campaign.  Staff assistant to U.S. Rep. Jack Kemp (NY),
1979-80.  B.A. in English from University of Maryland.
State Director  Jennifer Locetta
(announced July 18, 2016)  Deputy state director on Trump's Florida
primary campaign, announced Nov. 2015.  Campaign manager on Richard
DeNapoli's unsuccessful primary run for state representative in Sarasota
County, 2014.  Florida data director on Mitt Romney's presidential
campaign, May-Nov. 2012.  Statewide data director for the Republican Party
of Kentucky, June-Nov. 2011.  Human resources and office manager at
Innoprise Software in Colorado, 2006-11.  B.A. in American studies from
University of Notre Dame, 2006.
Senior Consultant of Operations  Mary Anne Carter
Has run a political research and public affairs consulting firm
specializing in state and federal legislation, campaign and corporate
communications, media surveys, issue tracking and public policy analysis.
Chief advisor to Gov. Rick Scott through June 2011; executive director of
Gov.-elect Scott's transition team; oversaw all research and policy on the
Scott For Florida campaign; executive director of Scott's Conservatives
For Patients' Rights group.  Deputy campaign manager on Fred Thompson's
2008 presidential campaign.  Director of U.S. Senate relations at the
Heritage Foundation.  Opposition research director on Sen. Bob Dole's 1996
presidential primary effort.  Research director on Fred Thompson's 1994
campaign for U.S. Senate.
Chief of Staff  Darren Morris
Served as state director for Trump's Tennessee primary campaign,
announced Sept. 22, 2015.  President of Morris Global Strategies, a public
affairs and political consulting firm based in Nashville.  Has worked in
each presidential campaign cycle since 1996.

Deputy Communications Director  Healy Nardone

(July 2016)  Earlier served as chief state delegation whip at the
Republican National Convention, as Rhode Island state director, and from
Dec. 2015-March 2016 as a field consultant in NH, SC, TX, OH and WI.
Studied financial management and economics at Salve Regina University.
From Newport, RI.

Bachelor's degree in business management from Appalachian State
University, 2016.  Owner/operator of The Cutting Edge (landscaping) in

Director of Grassroots  Debbie Cox-Roush
Independent contractor for Wizcraft International/IIFA Tampa Bay,
2013-14.  Volunteer coordinator for the Republican National Convention,
April-Sept. 2012.  Florida director of county chairs on Friends of Herman
Cain presidential campaign, 2011, then Florida grassroots director on Newt
2012.  General manager for Concessions by Cox of Florida, Oct. 2003-July
2011.  Bachelor's degree from Georgetown College (KY).
Grassroots Coordinator  Samantha Hebert
Coalitions Director  Bibi Ramos
(Aug. 2016)  Has "been on staff in the Florida Governor's office, Florida
State House, the Florida Senate, as well as various State agencies... also
worked on Congressional as well as Statewide races and in the private
sector for family owned companies, and large corporations."  Graduate of
Florida State University.  Born and raised in Orlando, daughter of Cuban
immigrants.
Coalitions Coordnator  Alex Coffey
Commercial real estate brokerage, consulting and management with NAI
Global in Fort Lauderdale from April 2016.  Worked as a political
consultant from March 2009-April 2016 and as an associate in family
business from July 2013.  B.A. degree from University of Florida.
Coalitions Coordinator  Paul Janiczek
Risk management consultant from Nov. 2014.  Florida state director and
Mid-Atlantic field rep. for Concerned Veterans for America, Jan. 2013-Nov.
2014.  Director of government operations at Genufi Cyber Intelligence,
Nov. 2009-June 2012.  Subcontractor/subject matter expert with IDS
International, Sept. 2008-Nov. 2009.  Deputy Assistant Inspector General
with the Special Inspector for Iraq Reconstruction, Jan.-Oct. 2007.
Special advisor at the U.S. Department of State, Sept. 2002-March 2006.
Foreign affairs officer at the U.S. Department of State, Jan. 2001-Sept.
2002.  Staff assistant in the U.S. House, Feb. 1999-Jan. 2001.  M.S. in
national security and strategic studies from the Naval War College, 2004;
B.S. in history from Frostburg State University, 1997.  Served in the US
Navy Reserve, June 1992-March 2004.

Campaign manager on Carlos Beruff for Senate (FL), Jan.-July 2016.
National field director on Jindal for President (based in Des Moines),

Started on the campaign as Alabama director of outreach and coalitions,

Communications Director  Ninio Fetalvo

Chairman  Rep. Blaise Ingoglia
(elected Jan. 17, 2015)  Elected to the Florida House of Representatives
representing District 25 (most of Hernando County) in 2014.  Businessman.
Founded and produced "Government Gone Wild" seminars in 2007.  Tournament
poker player.  Founded Hartland Homes, a home building company in 2001.
Founded America One Mortgage in 1998.
Vice Chairman  Joe Gruters
(announced as chairman of Trump's Florida primary campaign on Oct.
25-2015)  Vice chairman of the Republican Party of Florida from Dec. 2008
and chairman of the Republican Party of Sarasota from Dec. 2008.  Owner of
Gruters CPA in Sarasota since Aug. 2015.  CPA and tax manager at Shinn &
Company LLC, Jan. 2010-July 2015.  Campaign manager, political director
and director of government relations for Buchanan Enterprises and Vern
Buchanan for Congress, 2000-09.  Vice president and project manager for
Yacht Clubs of the Americas, Dec. 2006-May 2008.  Project manager for
Githier Development, Sept. 2004-April 2006.  M.B.A. from University of
South Florida's College of Business, 2002; B.S. from Florida State
University's College of Business, 1999.  Fourth generation Sarasotan.

Executive Director  George Riley
(announced Jan. 3, 2016 as acting ex. dir., succeeding Brad Herold)
Various roles at the Party since 2008 including director of party affairs,
political director in 2014, member relations director, and Victory

and Jack Latvala for SD 16 races in 2010.  Field director for the Tampa
Victory Office in 2008.  B.A. in history from Gettysburg College.
